meanings.definition: Make immune to a disease by inoculation.
meanings.sent1: Doctors immunise children to protect them from getting sick.
meanings.sent2: It is important to immunise your pets to keep them healthy.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's special power was to immunise people from all illnesses with a single touch.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude seemed to immunise her from the negativity around her.
meanings.sent5: The magical potion could immunise anyone who drank it against any illness.

meanings.sent1: The vaccine helps to immunise individuals against certain diseases.
meanings.sent2: The mother's antibodies can immunise the baby for the first few months of life.
meanings.sent3: The wizard used his spell to immunise the village from any harm.
meanings.sent4: His experience in the field of medicine seemed to immunise him from making mistakes.
meanings.sent5: The shield was said to immunise the warrior from all attacks.
